alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains; Espanola Valley; Far Northwest Highlands; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Northwest Plateau; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Santa Fe Metro Area; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southwest Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 01 at 1:47PM MST until December 02 at 6:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations up to two inches. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central, northwest, and west central New Mexico. * WHEN...Until 6 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes along portions of I-40. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.
